    • Method Detail

      • isConsistent

        public boolean isConsistent(SetOfPredicatesWithTerms agentContext)
        Description copied from interface: DomainFunctions
        Returns true if a given agentContext description is consistent, namely the situation it describes "makes sense". As an example, in a traffic scenario, a description that says "there is a car in front of me, and an ambulance to my right", makes sense, and hence the method should return true. By contrast, a situation like "there is a car in top of me" does not make sense, and hence the method should return false

        NOTE: In a domain in which any combination of the predicates and terms would make sense, this method could return always true.

        NOTE 2: You should implement this method only if you are going to use the IRON norm synthesis strategy. Otherwise, there is no need that you implement this method, which could return false always.

        Specified by:
        isConsistent in interface DomainFunctions
        Parameters:
        agentContext - the agent context description
        Returns:
        true if the set of predicates and terms is consistent, namely it makes sense. It returns false otherwise

      • agentContextFunction

        public EnvironmentAgentContext agentContextFunction(long agentId,
                                                    View view)
        Description copied from interface: DomainFunctions
        Returns the local context of a reference agent with id agentId in a given view. The context of an agent in a view is a description of the view from the agent's local perspective, in terms of the agent language. In other words, the agent context describes how the agent is perceiving the view, by means of its words
        Specified by:
        agentContextFunction in interface DomainFunctions
        Parameters:
        agentId - the id of the reference agent
        view - the view in which the agent perceives its local context
        Returns:
        a SetOfPredicatesWithTerms that describes the agent's local context

      • getConflicts

        public java.util.List<Conflict> getConflicts(Goal goal,
                                             ViewTransition viewTransition)
        Description copied from interface: DomainFunctions
        Returns a List containing the new, non-regulated conflicts that have arisen during a transition of views viewTransition. That is, those conflicts that have been originated during the viewTransition by some agents to which no norms applied before the conflict.
        Specified by:
        getConflicts in interface DomainFunctions
        Returns:
        a List containing the new, non-regulated conflicts that have arisen during a transition of views viewTransition.
        See Also:
        Goal, Conflict

      • getConflicts

        public java.util.List<Conflict> getConflicts(Goal goal,
                                             ViewTransition viewTransition,
                                             long agentId)
        Description copied from interface: DomainFunctions
        Returns a List containing the new, non-regulated conflicts that an agent with id agentId is involved in during a transition of views viewTransition. That is, those conflicts that have been originated during the viewTransition by the agent with id agentId to which no norms applied before the conflict.
        Specified by:
        getConflicts in interface DomainFunctions
        Returns:
        a List containing the new, non-regulated conflicts that an agent with id agentId is involved in during a transition of views viewTransition. That is, those conflicts that have been originated during the viewTransition by the agent with id agentId to which no norms applied before the conflict.
        See Also:
        Goal, Conflict
